rtega_mnemonic:
伽伽RSnursing, attending, entertainer
  • increasing strength 加 of people 亻: nursing or entertaining
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 加 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
瑜伽 [ yú jiā ]: yoga (loanword)
伽利略 [ jiā lì lüè ]: Galileo Galilei (1564-1642), Italian scientist
伽师 [ jiā shī ]: Peyzivat nahiyisi (Peyziwat county) in Kashgar prefecture 喀什地区 , west Xinjiang
伽利略·伽利雷 [ jiā lì lüè · jiā lì léi ]: Galileo Galilei (1564-1642), Italian scientist
阿伏伽德罗 [ ā fú jiā dé luó ]: Amedeo Avogadro (1776-1856), Italian scientist

    • 加 [ jiā ] to add to, to increase, to augment

humanum_full_description_en:
From " person " to " add " sound. "Kalan" is the provincial name of the Sanskrit transliteration word "Sangharama" (sangharama / samgharama). It originally referred to the residence of monks and later became a general term for Buddhist temples. "Jade articles. "Human Ministry": "Gara, Gara." For example, "Luoyang Gara" is a work that recalled the grand occasion of the temples in Luoyang when Yang Xuanzhi revisited Luoyang after the fall of the Northern Wei Dynasty. "Luoyang Kalan Records. "Preface": "In the capital, where there are more than a thousand temples, today’s liaoguo, the bells are rarely heard. I fear that there will be no future generations, so I wrote the record. However, the number of temples is the most, so you can’t write it all over. Among them, the lesser ones are based on the auspiciousness and difference, the truth of the world, and the mundane things.” Another example is the Tang Dynasty Lu Yuantai's "Remonstrations on the Buddhist Temples of Jian Guangxiu": If the country is not settled, is it Buddhism?"

" Gal " with " eggplant ", expressed eggplant. Such as "Guwenyuan. Yang Xiong "Fu of the Capital of Shu": "Shengdong cultivates bamboo shoots, old dishes increase Jiao." Zhang Qiao's note: "Jia, now for eggplant." Tang Dynasty Duan Chengshi "Youyang Zazuo. "Cao Pian": "Eggplant, the name of the stem of the lotus in the eggplant character, the leather is reversed. Today Hujia, it is unknown.
humanum_short_description_en: From " person " to " add " sound. "Kalan" is the provincial name of the Sanskrit transliteration word "Sangharama" (sangharama / samgharama). It originally referred to the residence of monks and later became a general term for Buddhist temples.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，「加」聲。「伽藍」是梵語音譯詞「僧伽藍摩」（sangharama / samgharama）的省稱，原指僧侶的住處，後成為佛寺的通稱。《玉篇．人部》：「伽，伽藍也。」例如《洛陽伽藍記》就是北魏滅亡後，楊衒之重游洛陽時，追憶當年洛陽城內寺廟盛況的著作。《洛陽伽藍記．序》：「京城表裏，凡有一千餘寺，今日寮廓，鐘聲罕聞。恐後世無傳，故撰斯記。然寺數最多，不可遍寫；今之所錄，上大伽藍，其中小者，取其祥異，世諦俗事，因而出之。」又如唐代呂元泰〈諫廣修佛寺疏〉：「釋教行於中國，伽藍徧於天下，然喪亂不絕，邦國未安者，豈佛教之使然乎？」

　　「伽」同「茄」，表示茄子。如《古文苑．揚雄〈蜀都賦〉》：「盛冬育筍，舊菜增伽。」章樵注：「伽，今作茄。」唐代段成式《酉陽雜俎．草篇》：「茄子，茄字本蓮莖名，革遐反。今呼伽，未知所成。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，「加」聲。「伽藍」是梵語音譯詞「僧伽藍摩」（sangharama / samgharama）的省稱，原指僧侶的住處，後成為佛寺的通稱。

It originally referred to the residence of monks and later became a general term for Buddhist temples. "Jade articles. "Human Ministry": "Gara, Gara." For example, "Luoyang Gara" is a work that recalled the grand occasion of the temples in Luoyang when Yang Xuanzhi revisited Luoyang after the fall of the Northern Wei Dynasty. "Luoyang Kalan Records. "Preface": "In the capital, where there are more than a thousand temples, today’s liaoguo, the bells are rarely heard. I fear that there will be no future generations, so I wrote the record. However, the number of temples is the most, so you can’t write it all over. Among them, the lesser ones are based on the auspiciousness and difference, the truth of the world, and the mundane things.” Another example is the Tang Dynasty Lu Yuantai's "Remonstrations on the Buddhist Temples of Jian Guangxiu": If the country is not settled, is it Buddhism?" 伽字的基本解释

伽
qié
〔伽南香〕沉香。
〔伽蓝〕梵语“僧伽蓝摩”的简称，指僧众所住的园林，后指佛寺。

伽
jiā
〔伽倻〕朝鲜乐器名，有些像中国的筝。

伽
gā
〔伽马射线〕即“丙种射线”，镭和其他一些放射性元素的原子放出的射线，应用于工业和医学等领域。

伽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qié］
［《廣韻》求迦切，平戈，羣。］
(1)同“茄”。
(2)梵语gha的译音。悉昙体文三十五字中牙声的第四音。
(3)见“伽伽”。
[②]［jiā］
［《字彙》具牙切］
见“伽2倻琴”、“伽2持”。
[③]［gā］
译音用字。见“伽3馬射綫”。

伽字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　伽； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页97第12
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】求迦切【正韻】具牙切，?音茄。伽藍，神名。　又【梵書】那伽，龍也。竭伽，犀也。僧伽藍，衆園也。譯云園，取生植義，今浮屠所居是也。凡稱釋氏曰僧伽。　又【舊唐書·柳公綽傳】精釋典瑜伽，智度大論，皆再鈔。【法苑珠林】有瑜伽論。　又【南方草木狀】术，西域謂之乞力伽。　又【酉陽雜俎】那伽花，狀如三脊，無葉，花色白，心黃，六瓣，出舶上。　又【本草】覆盆子，一名畢楞伽。　又伽那，象也。見【騈雅】。　又摩伽，異獸名。【徐氏賓遠賦】獸則摩伽招賢。　又頻伽，人面鳥也。見【釋典】。又【舊唐書·憲宗紀】元和十八年，訶陵國獻僧祇僮，頻伽鳥二枚。　又與茄同。【揚雄·蜀都賦】盛冬育筍，舊菜增伽。【章樵註】伽茄古字通。

伽字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
伽字的起名意思

：读qié时指沉香或佛寺。读jiā时指一种朝鲜乐器伽倻，有些像中国的筝。

Jia
Basic explanation of words
Jia
qié
[Ghanan Incense] Agarwood.
[Kalan] The abbreviation of "Sangha Ram" in Sanskrit, refers to the garden where the monks live, and later refers to the Buddhist temple.
Jia
jiā
[Gaya] The names of North Korean musical instruments are somewhat like the Chinese Zheng.
Jia
gā
[Gamma rays] are "gamma rays", rays emitted by atoms of radium and some other radioactive elements, and are used in industry and medicine.
Jia
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qié］
["Guangyun" ask Jiaqie, Pingge, group. ]
(1) Same as "aubergine".
(2) Transliteration of Sanskrit gha. The fourth tone of yasheng in the thirty-five characters of Xitan style.
(3) See "Jaga".
[②]［jiā］
["Words" with teeth cut]
See "Gia 2 Diaoqin", "Gia 2 Holding".
[③] [gā]
Transliteration of words. See "Gamma 3 Ray".
Jia
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　加; Kangxi Strokes: 7; Page Number: Page 97-12
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Seeking Jiaqie [Zheng Yun] with teeth cut, sound eggplant. Kalan, the name of the god.　[Sanskrit] Naga, the dragon. Exhausted, rhinoceros. Sangha blue, the public gardens too. Translated into Yunyuan, where he lived and planted righteousness, is also where the Buddha lives today. Everyone is called the Sangha.　[Old Tang Book·Liu Gong Chuan Zhuan] Explaining classic yoga, wisdom and wisdom, all re-money. [Fayuan Zhulin] There is yoga theory.　[Southern vegetation] technique, the Western Regions is called Kiliga.　[Youyang Miscellaneous] Najia flower, shaped like three ridges, without leaves, white in color, yellow in heart, six petals, on the ship.　[Materia Medica] Raspberry, a biranga.　Gana, the elephant. See 【騈雅】.　Maga, the name of a different animal. [Xu's Bin Yuan Fu] The beast is the Maga to recruit talents.　Pin Jia again, human face bird. See 【Explanation】. Also [Book of the Old Tang Dynasty·Xianzong Ji] Yuan and eighteen years, the Hanling Kingdom presented a monk and a child, and two Pinjabirds.　 Same as eggplant again. 【Yangxiong·Shudu Fu】Born to raise bamboo shoots in winter, and old dishes to increase the size. 【Zhang Qiao's Note】The ancient characters of Jiaqi are well known.

Old glyph
Jia
Name meaning
: When reading qié, it means agarwood or Buddhist temple. When pronounced jiā, it refers to a North Korean musical instrument called Gaya, which is somewhat like the Chinese Zheng.
jiā, gā, qié
только в сочетаниях (преимущественно в заимствованиях из санскрита, для слогов kā, ga, gā, gha, ghā)
